column1: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.Marcus Aurelius
He who fears death will never do anything worth of a man who is alive.Seneca
We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.Seneca
The obstacle is the way.Marcus Aurelius
Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.Marcus Aurelius
It's not what happens to you
column2: but how you react to it that matters.Epictetus

column1: The greater the difficulty
column2: the more glory in surmounting it.Seneca

column1: No person has the power to have everything they want
column2: but it is in their power not to want what they don't have.Seneca

column1: Do not act as if you were going to live ten thousand years. Death hangs over you. While you live
column2: while it is in your power

column1: Choose not to be harmed and you won't feel harmed. Don't feel harmed and you haven't been.Marcus Aurelius
You have power over your mind
column2: not outside events. Realize this
column3: and you will find strength.Marcus Aurelius

column1: What progress
column2: you ask have I made? I have begun to be a friend to myself.- Seneca

column1: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.Epictetus
If a man knows not to which port he sails
column2: no wind is favorable.Seneca

column1: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past
column2: neglect the present

column1: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.Marcus Aurelius
If it is not right
column2: do not do it

column1: First learn the meaning of what you say
column2: and then speak.Epictetus

column1: If you are distressed by anything external
column2: the pain is not due to the thing itself
column3: but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.Marcus Aurelius

column1: No man is free who is not master of himself.Epictetus
Wealth consists not in having great possessions
column2: but in having few wants.Epictetus

column1: Difficulties strengthen the mind
column2: as labor does the body.Seneca

column1: If you really want to escape the things that harass you
column2: what you’re needing is not to be in a different place but to be a different person.Seneca

column1: True happiness is to enjoy the present
column2: without anxious dependence upon the future.Seneca

column1: It does not matter what you bear
column2: but how you bear it.Seneca

column1: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.Marcus Aurelius
It is not the man who has too little that is poor
column2: but the one who hankers after more.Seneca

column1: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.Seneca
The only way to happiness is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.Epictetus
The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.Marcus Aurelius
He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not
column2: but rejoices for those which he has.Epictetus

column1: A gem cannot be polished without friction
column2: nor a man perfected without trials.Seneca

column1: If one does not know to which port one is sailing
column2: no wind is favorable.Seneca

column1: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.Seneca
Don't seek for everything to happen as you wish it would
column2: but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will—then your life will be serene.Epictetus

column1: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.Epictetus
He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not
column2: but rejoices for those which he has.Epictetus

column1: Wealth consists not in having great possessions
column2: but in having few wants.Epictetus

column1: A wise man is content with his lot
column2: whatever it may be
column3: without wishing for what he has not.Seneca

column1: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.Seneca
No man is free who is not master of himself.Epictetus
Wealth is the slave of the wise. The master of the fool.Seneca
The tranquility that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think
column2: or do. Only what you do.Marcus Aurelius

column1: Men are disturbed not by things
column2: but by the view which they take of them.Epictetus

column1: It is not the man who has too little that is poor
column2: but the one who hankers after more.Seneca

What progress
column2: you ask
column3: have I made? I have begun to be a friend to myself.Seneca

column2: but he should fear never beginning to live.Marcus Aurelius

column2: do not do it
